verses.verse: The wise<WH2450> woman<WH802> builds<WH1129> her house,<WH1004> But the foolish<WH200> tears<WH2040> it down<WH2040> with her own hands.<WH3027>
He who walks<WH1980> in his uprightness<WH3476> fears<WH3372> the Lord,<WH3068> But he who is crooked<WH3868> in his ways<WH1870> despises<WH959> Him.
In the mouth<WH6310> of the foolish<WH191> is a rod<WH2415> for [his] back,<WH1346> But the lips<WH8193> of the wise<WH2450> will preserve<WH8104> them.
Where no<WH369> oxen<WH504> are, the manger<WH18> is clean,<WH1249> But much<WH7230> increase<WH8393> [comes] by the strength<WH3581> of the ox.<WH7794>
A faithful<WH529> witness<WH5707> will not lie,<WH3576> But a false<WH8267> witness<WH5707> speaks<WH6315> lies.<WH3577>
A scoffer<WH9238> seeks<WH1245> wisdom,<WH2451> and [finds] none,<WH369> But knowledge<WH1847> is easy<WH7043> to him who has<WH995> understanding.<WH995>
Leave<WH1980> the presence<WH5048> of a fool,<WH3684> Or you will not discern<WH3045> words<WH8193> of knowledge.<WH1847>
The wisdom<WH2451> of the prudent<WH6175> is to understand<WH995> his way,<WH1870> But the folly<WH200> of fools<WH3684> is deceit.<WH4820>
Fools<WH191> mock<WH9238> at sin,<WH817> But among<WH996> the upright<WH3477> there is good<WH7522> will.<WH7522>
The heart<WH3820> knows<WH3045> its own<WH5315> bitterness,<WH4787> And a stranger<WH2114> does not share<WH6148> its joy.<WH8057>
The house<WH1004> of the wicked<WH7563> will be destroyed,<WH8045> But the tent<WH168> of the upright<WH3477> will flourish.<WH6524>
There<WH3426> is a way<WH1870> [which seems] right<WH3477> to a man,<WH376> But its end<WH319> is the way<WH1870> of death.<WH4194>
Even<WH1571> in laughter<WH7814> the heart<WH3820> may be in pain,<WH3510> And the end<WH319> of joy<WH8057> may be grief.<WH8424>
The backslider<WH5472> in heart<WH3820> will have<WH7646> his fill<WH7646> of his own ways, But a good<WH2896> man<WH376> will [be satisfied] with his.
The naive<WH6612> believes<WH539> everything,<WH3605> But the prudent<WH6175> man<WH6175> considers<WH995> his steps.<WH9036>
A wise<WH2450> man<WH2450> is cautious<WH3372> and turns<WH5493> away<WH5493> from evil,<WH9563> But a fool<WH3684> is arrogant<WH9378> and careless.<WH982>
A quick-tempered man acts<WH6213> foolishly,<WH200> And a man<WH376> of evil<WH4209> devices<WH4209> is hated.<WH8130>
The naive<WH6612> inherit<WH5157> folly,<WH200> But the prudent<WH6175> are crowned<WH3803> with knowledge.<WH1847>
The evil<WH7451> will bow<WH7817> down<WH7817> before<WH6440> the good,<WH2896> And the wicked<WH7563> at the gates<WH8179> of the righteous.<WH6662>
The poor<WH7326> is hated<WH8130> even<WH1571> by his neighbor,<WH7453> But those who love<WH157> the rich<WH6223> are many.<WH7227>
He who despises<WH936> his neighbor<WH7453> sins,<WH2398> But happy<WH835> is he who is gracious<WH2603> to the poor.<WH6035>
Will they not go<WH8582> astray<WH8582> who devise<WH9177> evil<WH9563>? But kindness<WH2617> and truth<WH571> [will be to] those who devise<WH9177> good.<WH9185>
In all<WH3605> labor<WH6089> there is profit,<WH4195> But mere<WH8193> talk<WH1697> [leads] only<WH389> to poverty.<WH4270>
The crown<WH5850> of the wise<WH2450> is their riches,<WH6239> [But] the folly<WH200> of fools<WH3684> is foolishness.<WH200>
A truthful<WH571> witness<WH5707> saves<WH5337> lives,<WH5315> But he who speaks<WH6315> lies<WH3577> is treacherous.<WH4820>
In the fear<WH3374> of the Lord<WH3068> there is strong<WH5797> confidence,<WH4009> And his children<WH1121> will have<WH1961> refuge.<WH4268>
The fear<WH3374> of the Lord<WH3068> is a fountain<WH4726> of life,<WH9132> That one may avoid<WH5493> the snares<WH4170> of death.<WH4194>
In a multitude<WH7230> of people<WH5971> is a king's glory,<WH1927> But in the dearth<WH657> of people<WH3816> is a prince's ruin.<WH4288>
He who<WH750> is slow<WH750> to anger<WH639> has great<WH7227> understanding,<WH8394> But he who<WH7116> is quick-tempered exalts<WH7311> folly.<WH200>
A tranquil<WH4832> heart<WH3820> is life<WH9132> to the body,<WH1320> But passion<WH7068> is rottenness<WH7538> to the bones.<WH6106>
He who oppresses<WH6231> the poor<WH1800> reproaches<WH2778> his Maker,<WH6213> But he who is gracious<WH2603> to the needy<WH34> honors<WH3513> Him.
The wicked<WH7563> is thrust<WH1760> down<WH1760> by his wrongdoing,<WH9567> But the righteous<WH6662> has<WH2620> a refuge<WH2620> when he dies.<WH4194>
Wisdom<WH2451> rests<WH5117> in the heart<WH3820> of one who has<WH995> understanding,<WH995> But in the bosom<WH7130> of fools<WH3684> it is made<WH3045> known.<WH3045>
Righteousness<WH6666> exalts<WH7311> a nation,<WH1471> But sin<WH9128> is a disgrace<WH9155> to [any] people.<WH3816>
The king's favor<WH7522> is toward a servant<WH5650> who acts<WH7919> wisely,<WH7919> But his anger<WH5678> is toward him who acts<WH954> shamefully.<WH954>
